reviews.text: Originally had a standard room with a small double bed. The room was nice but a little small. We paid for a room upgrade which came with a larger bed. It was cracking and well worth a little more money. The staff were brilliant, the hotel was spotlessly clean. The hotel was full of personality and the breakfast was amazing. It the middle of old town with restaurants nearby. We absolutely loved the place. Hope to return next year for Christmas.

Magnificent charming hotel in the heart of Tallinn!

I was given the free upgrade to the Presidential Suite, which I really appreciated - not least because it happened to be my birthday at the same time. Also appreciated the sweet treats and sparkling wine in the room. Really made the day that much better.

Staff throughout our stay were really nice, particularly Vadym, who is more than a consummate professional.

In all, I thought this was a very impressive hotel and I would certainly like to come back in the future!

The attitude of this hotel was a Disgrace, one fully understands if you cancel less than 48 hours before arrival one is charged but if you only booked 4 hours before arriving and they expect you to cancel 48 before is asking for a miracle. The reason we cancelled was the said they had secure parking we then had a message to say they did not but there was public parking near by when we called they more or less said TO BAD YOU CANCELLED LESS THAN 48 HOURS BEFORE ARRIVAL. As we had stayed at about 7 hotels using Booking.com we were charged through them using my credit card . WHAT A DISGRACE BY BOTH THE HOTEL AND BOOKING.Com

When I say the Hotel Schlössle felt like home away from home, I mean it. And when you can have that “home away from home” feeling in a 5-star hotel—where luxury just feels like a cozy fireplace and a wonderful meal, instead of fussy refinery inaccessible to us regular folks? I think you’ll understand why it was my favourite hotel stay of my entire life, no exaggeration whatsoever.

I think there is something to the fact that the staff has the creative freedom to make special touches for guests that cycles back to employee happiness in their job (they aren’t just expected to check boxes and act as automatons) that makes you really feel like the enjoy being there for you! They truly don’t seem to mind the acts of service that make up the 5-star hotel experience. From the pillow menu (yes, a PILLOW MENU), to the arctic hot tub experience, where you can order drinks at the spa, to the teddy bear turn-down service they offer to children…I got the distinct impression that their freedom to make the experience customized for each guest allowed them to lean into the parts of their job that made it enjoyable and fun, which put me so at ease as a guest!

The rooms were impeccably maintained and the warm, cozy fireplaces I all the main areas, combined with candlelight made the 13th century bones of this building (yes, you read that right!) feel warm and inviting, like a place that had never lost its hospitality for a moment, even after 800 years. All of this, right in the heart of Old town Tallinn, with impeccably clean rooms and by far my favorite hotel breakfast—ever, hands down—and you will want to RUN and book this affordably priced hotel as fast as you can.
